intro: Acoelorraphe salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran acorae, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Acoraceae family, which includes aquatic and terrestrial plants. The plant features a short, rhizomatous stem with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Acoelorraphe salvadorensis plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
